Imposter.description: Thanks to Light Ball, Pikachu is a niche Imposter user that can break past less-sturdy Imposter-proofers, although it forgoes defensive utility in exchange. When Pikachu transforms, only the ability, item, and HP EVs listed here matter. The listed moves, non-HP EVs, and nature will very rarely see use: since Pikachu outspeeds all other Imposter users like Chansey, it is extremely rare that Pikachu is not transformed. Nevertheless, Volt Switch provides a reasonably strong pivoting option against opposing transformed Imposter users, which cause Pikachu's Imposter to fail, while Glare can paralyze threats to aid Pikachu later on. Healing Wish and Spikes both provide some utility if Pikachu is no longer needed. Since Pikachu is extremely frail, it can easily fall to any strong move from opposing threats it wants to transform into. Therefore, significant team support is needed to realize its potential. Paralysis spam through Nuzzle and Glare ensures Pikachu always outspeeds opposing threats like Mega Mewtwo X, and it can also generate free turns. Knock Off invalidates Pikachu, so Knock Off absorbers, such as Arceus with a held Plate are recommended. Bulky special walls like Ice Scales Arceus-Ground and Ho-Oh check Mega Diancie and Arceus-Ghost, which Pikachu cannot safely transform into: the former can OHKO with Extreme Speed, and the latter Imposter-proofs itself.

Choice Specs.description: Mega Alakazam is a powerful special wallbreaker and revenge killer by virtue of its nearly unparalleled Speed tier and sky-high Special Attack. Moongeist Beam provides coverage against opposing Psychic-types and Imposter users, and it also bypasses Ice Scales. Fleur Cannon OHKOes Yveltal and Dragon-types such as Mega Garchomp and Miraidon. Blue Flare is the strongest coverage option against Steel-types like Mega Steelix and Registeel. Beads of Ruin provides a general power boost to all moves, but Psychic Surge allows Mega Alakazam to use Expanding Force, which is more spammable than Psycho Boost, and Psystrike, which crushes Blissey and RegenVest users like Primal Kyogre. Mega Alakazam appreciates support from Imposter users and Knock Off users to remove Assault Vests from RegenVest Pokemon that could otherwise what move it locks into and Leftovers from Blissey to make it easier to wear down. Entry hazard support from RegenVest users with Stone Axe and Spikes users such as Eternatus can help Mega Alakazam achieve 2HKOes on targets like Ice Scales Arceus formes. RegenVests users like Primal Kyogre can additionally provide slow pivoting to bring Mega Alakazam in safely, as it is frail and susceptible to status conditions; these can also Imposter-proof Mega Alakazam if it isn't using Psystrike. Other Imposter-proofing options include Imposter Chansey and Ice Scales walls neutral to its attacks like Ho-Oh.

Physical Wall.description: Mega Slowbro's insanely high Defense and good typing make it an incredibly hard to break Fur Coat wall on balance teams, checking and forcing out common metagame threats like Mega Garchomp and Kyurem-B. Scald threatens to burn setup threats like Ice Scales Arceus-Ground, which could otherwise set up in Mega Slowbro's face, and it also deals solid damage. Future Sight has incredible synergy with Teleport, as it allows Mega Slowbro to support its offensive teammates by preventing opposing walls from safely switching in. Alternatively, Mortal Spin allows Mega Slowbro to serve as an entry hazard remover and cripple foes unaffected by burn, such as Ho-Oh. Covert Cloak prevents Mega Slowbro from being chipped by foes reliant on Salt Cure and Mortal Spin to make progress, while Rocky Helmet consistently chips wallbreakers in exchange for a worse matchup against passive walls like Mega Audino; Rocky Helmet also notably punishes Choice Band foes, such as Kyurem-B, for trying to easily up chip damage with U-turn. The pivoting and Future Sight support Mega Slowbro provides is heavily appreciated by wallbreakers that often fall just shy of 2HKOs, such as Mega Garchomp and Ash-Greninja; teammates with a bad matchup against various physical attackers are also appreciative of its walling capabilities, including the likes of Ice Scales Ho-Oh and Blissey. The aforementioned Blissey and other special walls like Ice Scales Arceus-Ground and Ho-Oh can also cover for dangerous foes like Miraidon and Flutter Mane, forming a solid defensive core. Since Ash-Greninja is one of the only wallbreakers that can dissuade Mega Slowbro from switching in, a check to it like Miraidon or Fur Coat Arceus-Fairy is appreciated. Mega Slowbro should be Imposter-proofed by a Take Heart user, ideally with Thunder Cage, as even if Mega Slowbro is able to burn or poison the Imposter user, it still acts as a free source of healing and Teleport momentum.

Imposter.description: With Imposter, Chansey transforms into a version of the opposing Pokemon with bulk that is far greater and can be further bolstered by Eviolite. This provides a myriad of benefits, including blanket checking most Pokemon, scouting sets, and PP stalling less threatening foes. These traits make Imposter Chansey a valuable addition to almost every team. The given moves offer the most utility in the rare situations Chansey is not transformed, allowing it to Imposter-proof certain special attackers and act as a cleric. While Eviolite is usually the best item, Covert Cloak is useful against Spirit Shackle and Salt Cure users, and Spooky Plate allows Chansey to threaten Arceus-Ghost and Lunala that would otherwise defeat it with Judgment. Offensive threats such as Ultra Necrozma appreciate the information Imposter Chansey provides through scouting; physical attackers in particular highly appreciate moves like Burning Bulwark being discovered. Special attackers enjoy Imposter Chansey taking advantage of RegenVest users and potentially Imposter-proofing them. Imposter Chansey appreciates slow pivoting from Pokemon like Celesteela and Mega Steelix so it can safely scout. Specially defensive Pokemon like Ice Scales Arceus formes and Magic Guard Blissey can serve as checks to opposing Take Heart Arceus formes, which can beat Imposter Chansey one-on-one, while also checking Dragon-type attackers like Eternatus and Miraidon that can hit it hard.

RegenVest.description: RegenVest Mega Steelix is a strong slow pivot and soft check to many Pokemon such as Take Heart Arceus formes and Flutter Mane. Gigaton Hammer threatens frail attackers like Mega Alakazam, as well as preventing Ice Scales Arceus Fairy from setting up even if it has Strength Sap. Mortal Spin can force chip damage on foes and remove entry hazards; however, Mega Steelix isn't a reliable enough remover to make itself the sole hazard removal on a team. Stone Axe supports Mega Steelix's offensive teammates with hazards, substantially helping Pokemon like Ultra Necrozma and Palkia-O deal with softer checks. Salt Cure is the strongest option for Imposter users, which otherwise safely exploit Mega Steelix for Regenerator recovery if their items aren't necessary, and it forces chip damage on foes Mortal Spin can't such as Take Heart Arceus formes. Mega Steelix cannot wall most threats long term, so backup checks to things like Flutter Mane such as Ice Scales Mega Audino are helpful. Imposter-proof Mega Steelix with Knock Off absorbers like Arceus-Ghost and Dialga-O.

Magic Guard.description: With naturally high Special Defense and HP along with a decent neutral typing against most attacks, Blissey is an effective special wall capable of checking various special threats like Eternatus and Miraidon. Magic Guard also gives Blissey an immunity to residual damage from sources such as Salt Cure and Thunder Cage, with the protection from the latter and its low Attack limiting healing from Strength Sap letting it check most Take Heart Arceus formes. Ruination is a way to make near-guaranteed progress barring a miss, and its consistent damage mitigates Blissey's otherwise-crippling passivity. Topsy-Turvy deters setup attempts from Take Heart and Nasty Plot users by inverting their boosts and likely forcing a switch, in which case Blissey can then pivot out with Teleport or Parting Shot. Blissey's ability to deny Strength Sap healing makes it a great pick on balance teams carrying physical attackers such as Mega Lucario, as Fur Coat walls with Strength Sap usually can't get past Blissey, and physical attackers can force Imposter users out if they switch in while Blissey is pivoting. Blissey's immense frailty means that reliable physical walls, such as Mega Slowbro, are mandatory to cover for it; Arceus-Ghost can also bypass Blissey with either Secret Sword or Triple Arrows, so Yveltal makes for a good teammate. Imposter-proof Blissey with any Regenerator user.

Ice Scales.description: Ho-Oh is an effective special wall capable of checking dangerous special attackers like Simple Lunala and Mega Gardevoir. Teleport is a fantastic move for slowly pivoting in offensive teammates. Knock Off can crucially remove items from Ho-Ohs's checks like Miraidon, Imposter Chansey, and Mega Slowbro. Mortal Spin in combination with STAB-boosted V-create allows Ho-Oh to function as a strong entry hazard remover thanks to its solid matchup against most Steel types, and Mortal Spin can heavily punish Imposter users on the switch. Topsy-Turvy crucially removes stat boosts against foes like Simple Arceus-Ghost and Lunala. Ho-Oh requires suitable Knock Off absorbers like Dialga-O and Arceus formes because of its glaring Stealth Rock weakness. Ho-Oh also struggles against Miraidon, Primal Kyogre, and most Take Heart Arceus formes, so teammates that can deal with them like Blissey and RegenVest Mega Swampert can help. Imposter-proof Ho-Oh with the aforementioned Knock Off absorbers, although they should ideally have a method to punish the Imposter user back. Steel-types not weak to Fire such as Primordial Sea Celesteela and Registeel can be used to block the Imposter user's Mortal Spin, although they must carry a move to prevent the Imposter user from freely healing with Recover.

Magic Guard.description: Good stats and the fabled STAB-boosted V-create make Ho-Oh a solid setup attacker. Magic Guard negates annoying chip damage from Mortal Spin and Salt Cure and allows for free use of Life Orb. Volt Tackle's very high PP and good damage output are excellent, as they allow Ho-Oh to both fish for paralysis on threats like Imposter users and also deal hefty damage, notably ensuring that Mega Slowbro can't wall it long-term. Swords Dance bolsters these moves even further, notably allowing V-create to OHKO neutral Arceus formes and Volt Tackle to 2HKO Mega Slowbro, in addition to preventing Imposter users and faster Pokemon like Eternatus and from permanently walling Ho-Oh with Strength Sap; alternatively, Headlong Rush allows Ho-Oh to hit foes like Eternatus and Fire-immune Steel-types like Registeel super effectively. Magic Guard Ho-Oh best fits on balance teams looking for a bulky setup attacker that wears down common walls and can potentially sweep late-game. Dragon-types are a notable thorn in Ho-Oh's side, particularly ones that use Strength Sap like Eternatus, so an ally that blocks Strength Sap like Magic Guard Blissey is a valuable teammate. Ho-Oh's damage potential also tanks without its Life Orb, so a Knock Off absorber like an Arceus forme is useful. Imposter-proof Swords Dance Ho-Oh with a Dragon-type teammate like Eternatus or Miraidon; Glacial Lance sets can be Imposter-proofed by any Fur Coat user, ideally one immune to or not bothered by potential paralysis.

Mega Sceptile is a decent fast attacker. Its main draw is its high Speed, giving it the jump on other common fast attackers like Ash-Greninja, Eternatus, and after chip damage, Flutter Mane. Life Orb-boosted Dragon Energy and Chloroblast pack a good punch, letting Mega Sceptile threaten neutral targets like Mega Audino, and Chloroblast uniquely matches up well against Mega Swampert and Arceus-Ground. Torch Song targets Steel-types like Celesteela and Magearna, and it can also enable late-game sweeps against softened teams. Mega Sceptile best fits on balance teams looking for a tool to out-offense traditional fast attackers like Eternatus without having to deal with a Choice lock like Mega Alakazam does. Mega Sceptile's damage isn't particularly high, even after Torch Song, and Strength Sap with only special moves means Strength Sap blockers like Magic Guard Blissey are a big problem; for this reason, Mega Sceptile should be used as a supporting piece for other special wallbreakers like Flutter Mane and Secret Sword Arceus-Ghost. Primordial Sea Steel-types like Registeel are also essentially immune to damage from Mega Sceptile, so Magic Guard users that can switch in and cut their utility are recommended. Mega Sceptile is frail and also needs to keep its Life Orb to deal any acceptable damage, so slow pivots like Mega Audino are essentially mandatory for it. Imposter-proof Mega Sceptile with a special wall like Magic Guard Blissey or Imposter Chansey.

RegenVest.description: RegenVest Mega Swampert is a reliable pivot with a strong advantage against Pokemon like Miraidon and Eternatus. Precipice Blade's high Base Power is generally preferred; however, Earthquake doesn’t miss. Mortal Spin can remove entry hazards particularly well thanks to Mega Swampert's Ground-type STAB move scaring off Steel-types like Registeel, and its ability to poison pairs well with Knock Off, which removes Covert Cloak from foes like Mega Audino. Stone Axe allows Mega Swampert to make progress against switch-ins like Arceus-Ghost. Frail offensive Pokemon like Mega Lucario, Blacephalon, and Mega Alakazam appreciate Mega Swampert's utility and its ability to stifle fast Dragon-types like Miraidon and Eternatus that would otherwise scare them out, with Mega Alakazam crucially outspeeding and KOing Miraidon and Eternatus, preventing them from spamming Strength Sap against Mega Swampert. Because of Mega Swampert's lack of incredible bulk, it cannot be relied on to wall most of the metagame; as a result, partners like Ho-Oh and Mega Audino are useful help against stronger special attackers like Mega Alakazam and Palkia-O. Salt Cure and Celesteela also greatly annoy Mega Swampert, so partners like Miraidon and other Magic Guard users help. Mega Swampert can be Imposter-proofed with Take Heart Arceus formes with a held Plate.

Ice Scales.description: Mega Swampert leverages its strong typing, usable bulk, and good Attack to be an effective Tidy Up user with an advantage against Miraidon and Ultra Necrozma. Tidy Up allows it to remove entry hazards while also allowing it to outspeed threats such as Mega Lucario and sweep late-game given roadblocks like Ho-Oh and Celesteela have been removed. Precipice Blades has higher power, notably OHKOing Registeel at +1, while Earthquake doesn’t miss. Spirit Shackle allows Mega Swampert to trap Imposter users while setting up, ensuring it exits the interaction at +6 with the Imposter user gone. Strength Sap has more PP then Recover and allows Mega Swampert to successfully beat Imposter users by itself. Covert Cloak helps Mega Swampert against moves like Salt Cure and Mortal Spin. Mega Swampert fits well on teams that appreciate its hazard removal capabilities and typing, notably providing a buffer against the aforementioned Miraidon and Ultra Necrozma. Mega Swampert's lack of a stat boost-removing move means bulky Topsy-Turvy users like Mega Audino and Yveltal are appreciated to take on bulky setup sweepers like Simple Arceus-Ghost, Mega Audino as well as Blissey can also beat Take Heart Arceus Formes which Mega Swampert can struggle against. Mega Swampert can be Imposter-proofed by itself, but in an emergency, most Topsy-Turvy users and bulky Flying-types like Celesteela, Ho-Oh, and Yveltal will do the same.

Pixilate.description: Pixilate Mega Gardevoir distinguishes itself from Mega Diancie through its higher damage output and STAB-boosted Psystrike, allowing it to heavily pressure Poison-types and RegenVest Primal Kyogre. Volt Switch eases prediction and helps chip targets like Primal Kyogre and Ho-Oh into 2HKO range from Boomburst. Armor Cannon provides the strongest general coverage against Steel-types like Mega Steelix, while Steam Eruption hits Ho-Oh for super effective damage while also dealing respectable damage against Primordial Sea Steel-types. Mega Gardevoir is capable of applying pressure onto common specially defensive walls such as Ice Scales Arceus formes, but it can need help taking down walls like Ice Scales Ho-Oh. Thus, partners like Eternatus and Palkia-O are helpful to assist in pressuring opposing Ice Scales users, while they appreciate Mega Gardevoir helping deal with RegenVest Primal Kyogre. Mega Gardevoir also appreciates paralysis support, such as from RegenVest Nuzzle users like Celesteela, to help with its middling Speed. Depending on coverage, Mega Gardevoir can be Imposter-proofed by teammates such as Victini, Ferrothorn, and Ice Scales Arceus formes.

RegenVest.description: RegenVest Primal Kyogre is a useful special wall, pivot, and utility Pokemon, notably checking foes like Flutter Mane, Palkia-O, and Eternatus. Flip Turn allows Primal Kyogre to safely scout moves from opposing threats like Choice Specs Flutter Mane and then swap into the appropriate answer, be it an Imposter Pokemon or an Ice Scales user. Scald is typically preferred over Steam Eruption thanks to its higher PP, but some teams may appreciate the extra power of Steam Eruption. Knock Off cripples item-reliant Pokemon like Chansey, RegenVest Dialga, and RegenVest Celesteela along with removing Covert Cloak to let it status Pokemon it otherwise couldn't, such as Mega Audino. Mortal Spin's entry hazard removal and poison-inflicting capabilities make it a good all-around utility choice, especially since Primal Kyogre has an excellent matchup against many of the metagame's Steel-types, like Mega Steelix and Celesteela. Nuzzle can slow down wallbreakers like Eternatus and Choice Specs Flutter Mane, and Stone Axe can help wear down foes for allies. Primal Kyogre's fear of physical wallbreakers like Mega Garchomp, Ash-Greninja, and Ultra Necrozma makes reliable checks to them, like Fur Coat Mega Audino and Ice Scales Arceus-Ground, useful teammates. Special wallbreakers like Flutter Mane, Eternatus, and Miraidon appreciate Knock Off removing items from opposing RegenVest users and Ability Shields from Pokemon like Ice Scales Arceus-Ground. Imposter-proof Primal Kyogre with a Take Heart Arceus forme holding a Plate.

Setup Attacker.description: Groudon's base stats and STAB on Precipice Blades make it a premier choice for a bulky attacker. Fur Coat allows Groudon to wall many common threats, such as Koraidon and opposing Groudon, while Mold Breaker ignores Fur Coat and Levitate on walls like Eternatus, Arceus-Ghost, and Zamazenta-C. Victory Dance lets it reliably set up on opposing physical attackers like Groudon and Koraidon, whereas Tidy Up removes entry hazards and makes it harder for Imposter users to safely switch in thanks to the lack of a Defense boost. Toxic heavily cripples Precipice Blades switch-ins like Arceus formes and Dondozo, and it works especially well with Mold Breaker, which lets Groudon bait and punish Prankster users. Alternatively, Knock Off removes Heavy-Duty Boots, Leftovers, and Ability Shield from bulkier targets like Dondozo, Eternatus, and opposing Groudon. Earth Plate boosts Precipice Blades's damage, whereas Heavy-Duty Boots leaves Groudon less susceptible to chip damage from Spikes, and Rocky Helmet provides extra security against Population Bomb users like Ursaluna. Groudon's best fit is on balance and offense teams that want to compress a bulky attacker, non-passive wall, and possibly an entry hazard remover into a single teamslot. Teammates like Dondozo and Eternatus are recommended to shore up Groudon's weakness to Palafin-H, with the latter also helping out against Solar Beam Arceus-Fire. Use Corviknight to Imposter-proof Toxic and Mold Breaker Groudon variants, and a Fur Coat user that doesn't mind Knock Off for other variants.

Aerilate.description: Rayquaza is a dangerous mixed attacker with very few consistent long-term answers. Tera Flying Boomburst deals absurd damage, OHKOing everything that isn't a special wall or Flying-resistant target and 2HKOing many resistant foes like Corviknight and Dialga-O, provided the latter's Assault Vest has been removed. Extreme Speed helps chase out opposing offensive threats like Flutter Mane and Koraidon; Tera Flying Extreme Speed also 2HKOes Arceus and Zacian. Both coverage moves nuke Steel-types; Collision Course beats Chansey and is easier to Imposter-proof, while Headlong Rush beats Arceus-Electric and Zacian-C and makes offensive Imposter-proofing easier thanks to lowered defenses. Strength Sap helps offset Life Orb recoil and takes advantage of the switches Rayquaza forces, while Jungle Healing allows it to completely nullify Toxic Groudon at the cost of lower healing per use. Rash is used to maximize damage output, while Naive allows Rayquaza to outrun Jolly Groudon and most opposing Rayquaza. Rayquaza offers basically no defensive utility and hates taking status or Knock Off, meaning slow pivoting support from Dondozo and RegenVest users like Dialga-O is mandatory. Entry hazard setters like Zacian and RegenVest users are recommended, as hazards help remove Rayquaza's need to predict and allow it to safely spam Boomburst. Imposter-proof Rayquaza with Ice Scales Arceus formes, Soundproof users, or Zacian-C.

Choice Band.description: Choice Band Mega Garchomp is a strong wallbreaker thanks to its high Attack and good STAB moves. Dragon + Ground offers good coverage that only Celesteela resists, and even then, it needs to be using Fur Coat to survive two uses of Glaive Rush; Mega Garchomp also isn't weak to Stealth Rock, giving it an advantage over a close competitor in Kyurem-B. Headlong Rush is generally better than Precipice Blades, as it doesn't miss and Imposter users aren't immune to Tough Claws's damage boost, but Precipice Blades has more PP and doesn't make contact. Sunsteel Strike is necessary for smashing through Fur Coat Mega Audino and Arceus-Fairy, which are otherwise unbreakable walls. Bolt Strike can 2HKO Fur Coat Mega Slowbro and Celesteela; alternatively, U-turn can provide momentum and still help weaken Mega Slowbro. While Mega Garchomp is powerful, it isn't fast, meaning Fur Coat Arceus formes can always outspeed it and attempt to heal with Strength Sap; as a result, allies that can limit Strength Sap's recovery, such as Blissey and Magic Bounce users, are good support. Most other offensive Pokemon in the tier outspeed Mega Garchomp and chase it out, so solid defensive options like Mega Audino, Celesteela, and Arceus formes are recommended. Mega Garchomp also requires correct prediction to make any substantial progress, so reliable pivots like RegenVest users are useful. Mega Garchomp's use of four contact moves means Burning Bulwark is a massive problem, so an Imposter user can help with scouting in order to avoid a disaster. Imposter-proof Mega Garchomp with a bulky Fur Coat user like Mega Slowbro, Celesteela, or an Arceus forme; if Mega Garchomp is using Bolt Strike, Celesteela shouldn't be used, but Mega Slowbro still works.

Setup Sweeper.description: Mega Garchomp is a strong late-game sweeper, bursting through foes with its strong boosted Glaive Rush and Headlong Rush. Shift Gear allows Mega Garchomp to outspeed every Pokemon in the tier, including most +1 foes, while Tidy Up clears entry hazards. Jungle Healing allows Mega Garchomp to set up in the face of Mortal Spin users like Mega Steelix, helps deal with burns from Burning Bulwark, and limits the recovery any Imposter users can steal. 164 Defense EVs ensure Eviolite Imposter Chansey is OHKOed by +1 Glaive Rush. Mega Garchomp can never break through Fur Coat Pokemon like Arceus-Fairy, Mega Audino, Mega Slowbro, and Celesteela by itself, so teammates like Mega Lucario and Ultra Necrozma can help by dealing with these checks. Mega Garchomp enjoys teammates that can block or reduce Strength Sap's healing like Blissey or Mega Slowbro. Finally, Mega Garchomp appreciates being slowly pivoted onto the field by Pokemon such as Mega Swampert, Mega Audino, and Mega Steelix to provide it with as many opportunities to set up as possible. To Imposter-proof Mega Garchomp, you can use Fur Coat Arceus-Fairy, Arceus-Ghost, or Mega Slowbro.

Choice Band.description: Mega Lucario's potent STAB combination and serviceable Speed tier make it an effective wallbreaker on balance teams. Sunsteel Strike ignoring Fur Coat further differentiates Mega Lucario from other wallbreakers of its caliber, denting walls like Arceus-Ghost and Yveltal more easily; Steel STAB also notably makes it much more effective against Fur Coat Mega Audino. Bolt Strike decimates Ho-Oh, 2HKOes Fur Coat Celesteela, and can potentially eliminate Mega Slowbro after chip damage and entry hazards. U-turn allows Mega Lucario to escape unfavorable matchups like Fur Coat Arceus-Ghost to bring in a teammate that can handle them, and it can also help accumulate chip damage on Mega Slowbro. Mega Lucario's good matchup against Fur Coat walls like Mega Audino and Arceus-Fairy makes it synergize well with teammates like Ash-Greninja and Mega Garchomp; it also appreciates entry hazards from teammates like RegenVest pivots utilizing Stone Axe. Said RegenVest pivots can also bring in Mega Lucario via slow pivoting, which is helpful, since its poor bulk and complete reliance on its held item prevent it from doing so on its own. Other slow pivots like Teleport Mega Audino and Dialga-O are also appreciated, with Dialga-O in particular setting up uncomfortable situations for the opponent with Doom Desire, enhancing Mega Lucario's wallbreaking ability. Mega Lucario should be Imposter-proofed with Fur Coat Mega Slowbro or a neutral Fur Coat wall like Arceus-Ghost.

RegenVest.description: RegenVest Dialga-O acts as a reliable pivot and a check to some special attackers like Miraidon and Eternatus. Revelation Dance hits Flutter Mane and Mega Audino for major damage, preventing the former from using Dialga-O as a free Nasty Plot window and the latter from using it as a free Teleport window. Doom Desire can enable attackers that struggle to break through Fairy-type walls like Mega Garchomp and Ash-Greninja due to their one-sided wallbreaking nature shoehorning your opponent into specific response patterns; alternatively, Draco Meteor threatens Miraidon and Eternatus. Additionally, Revelation Dance + Draco Meteor hits both Flutter Mane and Dragon-type attackers, (comma) but Dialga-O can't provide Doom Desire support if this combination is run. Replacing either move with Doom Desire forces you to pick what Dialga-O can and can't beat, but it's still able to pivot into a teammate that takes care of foes that it struggles with. Knock Off removes key items such as Assault Vest from RegenVest Mega Steelix, Salt Cure heavily deters Steel-types that would otherwise endlessly wall Dialga-O, Rapid Spin acts as decent entry hazard removal, and Stone Axe can be used as a reliable way to set entry hazards. A Quiet nature is recommended for Revelation Dance to potentially KO Flutter Mane after three turns of burn damage and Draco Meteor to OHKO Miraidon, but a Sassy nature provides greater safety against threats like Mega Alakazam. Teammates that struggle to break through Fairy-types appreciate Dialga-O hitting them with Doom Desire, (comma) as mentioned previously, along with the slow pivoting it provides. Teammates vulnerable to Thunder Cage and Mortal Spin like Mega Slowbro also appreciate Dialga-O checking users of these moves. Dialga-O cannot break through Steel-types without Salt Cure, so a Pokemon that can pivot in and break them like Magic Guard Ho-Oh makes for a good partner. Dialga-O is heavily reliant on Assault Vest to actually check threats, so a partner that can absorb Knock Off like Arceus-Ghost also synergizes well with it. Imposter-proof Dialga-O with a neutral Ice Scales user, a Steel-type if it's not running Salt Cure, or Imposter Chansey if it's not running Knock Off.

Nasty Plot Sweeper.description: Nasty Plot Palkia-O is a terrifying sweeper thanks to its brutally powerful STAB combination and good Speed. A Timid nature guarantees that Palkia-O outspeeds and threatens to OHKO almost all Arceus. Steam Eruption provides more consistent damage output and a potential burn, while Water Spout has potentially higher damage, won't miss, and can OHKO Ice Scales Arceus-Fairy after Nasty Plot and Spikes. Strength Sap is necessary to keep Dragon Energy and Water Spout's damage high as well as to allow Palkia-O greater freedom to switch in. Tera Dragon allows Dragon Energy to OHKO Dondozo and +4 Dragon Energy to OHKO Ice Scales Dialga-O, while Tera Water lets Palkia-O withstand Fairy-type attacks from users like Arceus-Fairy and Zacian. Palkia-O's best fit is on offense teams that can maximize the opportunities it gets and can easily pressure faster threats like Koraidon. Prankster and Ice Scales Chansey are complete counters for Palkia-O, as they are never threatened by its attacks and make Strength Sap worthless; as such, mixed attacking teammates like Enamorus and Triple Arrows Arceus-Ghost are highly recommended. Imposter-proof Palkia-O with a Desolate Land Arceus-Fairy or Ice Scales Chansey.

Prankster.description: Prankster + Haze Giratina's huge bulk and recovery and disruption options allow it to function as a reliable answer to setup users. Giratina has a wide array of options it can use to disrupt foes attempting to set up: Glare paralyzes fast attackers such as Palkia-O, Encore keeps them locked into moves such as Nasty Plot, Parting Shot lets Giratina pivot and Destiny Bond trades a KO, and Entrainment helps force out ability-dependent attackers. Heavy-Duty Boots helps Giratina switch in more easily without fear of entry hazard chip, while Covert Cloak helps prevent status from moves like Mortal Spin and Nuzzle. Tera Fairy improves Giratina's matchup into opposing Dragon-types such as Koraidon while maintaining a Fighting-type resistance, whereas Tera Dark grants immunity to status moves from opposing Prankster users and a Ghost- and Dark-type resistance for Flutter Mane and Arceus-Dark. Great partners for Prankster Giratina include RegenVest Ting-Lu, Fur Coat Dondozo, and Imposter users thanks to their strong defensive synergy, which allows Giratina to get in more comfortably against Arceus-Ghost and Koraidon.

Magic Bounce.description: Giratina is a great defensive Pokemon that provides utility and disruption with its immunity to Fighting and resistance to powerful attacks like V-create and Rising Voltage. Court Change makes Giratina effective at removing entry hazards against Mold Breaker entry hazard setters and Stone Axe Pokemon. Strength Sap helps with keeping strong physical attackers such as Groudon in check. Whirlwind bypasses Substitute to force out foes, whereas Encore can be used as another form of disruption. Scald is useful for spreading burns, especially against physical attackers such as Groudon and Zamazenta-C. Tera Fairy is great for the immunity to Dragon-type attacks from Koraidon, Eternatus, and Palkia-O, while Tera Dark is great for being resistant to Ghost- and Dark-type attacks from Arceus-Ghost and Hoopa-Unbound. Covert Cloak helps Giratina beat Imposter users and blocks troublesome status from Scald and Mortal Spin. Dondozo and RegenVest Ting-Lu are great partners for Giratina thanks to their physical bulk and complementary typings, which help Giratina against threats such as Eternatus and Arceus-Ghost.

Take Heart.description: Arceus-Fairy's excellent typing allows it to check dangerous wallbreakers depending on its ability, with Fur Coat variants checking threats like Ash-Greninja and Mega Garchomp, while Ice Scales variants can handle threats like Palkia-O and Nasty Plot Arceus-Ghost. Fairy's good neutral coverage also allows Arceus-Fairy to double as a potent bulky setup threat. Take Heart allows Arceus-Fairy to boost its offenses and set up alongside threats like Arceus-Ghost; it also shakes off debilitating status from Mortal Spin. Thunder Cage provides good general coverage, hitting Celesteela and Ho-Oh, and it inflicts chip damage to special walls like Ice Scales Arceus formes. Strength Sap allows Arceus-Fairy to win one-on-one against Imposter users thanks to Thunder Cage and helps neutralize physical wallbreakers like Mega Garchomp. Pixie Plate lets Arceus-Fairy act as a good Knock Off absorber, while Covert Cloak prevents it from being chipped by Mortal Spin and Salt Cure. Revelation Dance is a niche option for Covert Cloak sets to still hit rare Normalize users. Fur Coat Arceus-Fairy has a poor matchup against Mega Lucario, so Lucario checks like Mega Slowbro and Victini are good teammates, with the former acting as a secondary check to Sunsteel Strike Mega Garchomp and the latter checking Ultra Necrozma. Ice Scales Arceus-Fairy can struggle against threats like Flutter Mane and Poison move Eternatus; as a result, teammates like Primal Kyogre and Blissey are appreciated. Arceus-Fairy generally can Imposter-proof itself, but a Pokemon that can Imposter-proof it as a backup like Imposter Chansey is helpful for when it is at low health.

Tidy Up.description: Arceus-Fairy is an effective entry hazard remover and check to various wallbreakers like Ash-Greninja, Mega Alakazam, and Mega Garchomp, depending on its ability. Fur Coat makes Arceus-Fairy a blanket check to physical attackers, while Ice Scales improves its matchup against special wallbreakers like the aforementioned Mega Alakazam and Miraidon. Beyond removing hazards, Tidy Up reduces Arceus-Fairy's overall passivity and gives it late-game sweeping potential when checks like Celesteela are gone. Spirit Shackle takes advantage of passive foes like Celesteela and Yveltal that don't have a move to remove Attack boosts and lets Arceus-Fairy potentially rack up boosts or switch to a teammate that can better exploit them; it also lets Arceus-Fairy trap Imposter users, which should always ensure the Imposter user faints and Arceus-Fairy gets +6 Attack. Strength Sap provides reliable recovery that lets Arceus-Fairy beat wallbreakers consisatently while also preventing it from being overwhelmed by physical setup sweepers and maintaining its ability to Imposter-proof itself. Covert Cloak allows Arceus-Fairy to completely wall passive foes reliant on moves like Mortal Spin and Salt Cure to make progress, forcing them out as a result, and it guarantees that Imposter users can't get past it via confusion. Arceus-Fairy's good utility makes it a solid fit on balance teams in need of hazard removal and a general check to physical attackers; its ability to remove said hazards makes teammates consistently annoyed by them, such as RegenVest users and wallbreakers like Ultra Necrozma, solid to use alongside it. Arceus-Fairy doesn't have a joyous time against Sunsteel Strike users like Mega Lucario and most Mega Garchomp, so Regenerator Celesteela is highly recommended to scout their moves beforehand. Arceus-Fairy also commonly invites in the likes of Celesteela and Dondozo, so teammates that take advantage of them like Mega Swampert and Magic Guard Miraidon are appreciated. Arceus-Fairy can Imposter-proof itself, as it wins the one-on-one against Imposter users through PP stalling, but a reasonably bulky Strength Sap user like Ho-Oh can help out if Arceus-Fairy is at very low HP and thus can't beat Imposter users without risking a Speed tie.

Utility Desolate Land.description: Fixes Desolate Land Arceus-Fire's main issue, being Imposter users, with Spirit Shackle. Offers additional utility with either entry hazard removal or the ability to easily dispatch Dondozo and Groudon.

Fur Coat.description: Arceus-Fire's great defensive typing and base stats make it a solid Fur Coat wall. Lava Plume's burn heavily cripples common physical attackers like Koraidon and Groudon and forces chip damage on opponents. Heal Bell allows Arceus-Fire to support its teammates by removing status conditions like paralysis, burn, and poison. U-turn allows Arceus-Fire to safely bring in offensive teammates to exploit passive Lava Plume switch-ins, such as Dondozo and Giratina; alternatively, Knock Off allows Arceus-Fire to remove items like Covert Cloak and Heavy-Duty Boots, as well as an Imposter user's Eviolite. Arceus-Fire best fits on balance teams that appreciate a reliable check to V-create users and a bulky pivot. Teammates like Palkia-O and Koraidon appreciate Arceus-Fire's pivoting and ability to bring in and force damage on passive walls. Imposter-proofing can be done with any Pokemon immune to burn, such as a Covert Cloak user. Tera Flying gives Arceus-Fire an immunity to Ground-type attacks from Groudon and Ursaluna, on top of gaining a Spikes immunity.

Desolate Land.description: Arceus-Fire's Desolate Land-boosted V-create is a brutally strong attack, letting it force out most Pokemon by threatening an OHKO. Arceus-Fire's niche over other V-create users is its powerful Solar Beam, which removes common physical walls such as Dondozo and Groudon. Growth enables Arceus-Fire to set up on passive walls, whereas Glacial Lance targets Dragon-types such as Eternatus and Giratina. Life Orb increases Arceus-Fire's power to absurd levels, OHKOing Arceus formes that don't resist its moves and 2HKOing most resistant targets with V-create. Heavy-Duty Boots, on the other hand, allows Arceus-Fire to take better advantage of its resistance to common Fairy- and Fire-type attacks. Arceus-Fire has difficulty breaking past Fire-immune foes, most commonly Well-Baked Body Steel-types, so it pairs well with teammates that can handle these targets like Groudon and Headlong Rush Enamorus. Imposter-proofing is done with Well-Baked Body Steel-types or Primordial Sea users. Tera Fire boosts the power of V-create even further, while Tera Grass grants a Ground resistance and a much stronger Solar Beam.

Fur Coat.description: Fur Coat Arceus-Ghost serves as both a sturdy physical wall and a potent setup wincon, having the unique ability to blank Knock Off and self-Imposter-proof with Spooky Plate + Judgment. Strength Sap is the preferred recovery option due to its higher healing against physical attackers like Mega Garchomp and ability to neutralize Attack boosts, but Shore Up can't be limited by Pokemon like Magic Guard Blissey. Take Heart and Nasty Plot bolster Arceus-Ghost's average Special Attack; Take Heart allows it to rid itself of sweep-ending poison from Mortal Spin, while Nasty Plot provides bigger boosts and means Shore Up sets can't be stalled by Imposter users. The last slot is dedicated to utility or coverage. Secret Sword nukes Blissey; Knock Off can ease Arceus-Ghost's sweep by removing Assault Vests, Yveltal's Heavy-Duty Boots, and the occasional Spooky Plate from Imposter users; Sludge Wave smashes Mega Audino and helps prevent Ice Scales Arceus-Fairy from PP stalling Arceus-Ghost; and Thunder Cage threatens Yveltal and Ho-Oh in addition to chipping special walls. Mega Garchomp appreciates Arceus-Ghost removing items from Yveltal and Mega Audino or, with certain coverage, straight up removing them; in return, Arceus-Ghost Imposter-proofs Mega Garchomp. Arceus-Ghost can struggle against Ash-Greninja, so a check to it like Fur Coat Mega Audino is a good partner. Arceus-Ghost generally Imposter-proofs itself, but in the event of your opponent having a rare Spooky Plate Imposter user, a teammate that can cover it like Magic Guard Blissey is recommended.

Simple.description: Simple Arceus-Ghost is a potent setup sweeper thanks to its good bulk, offensive profile, and natural advantage against Imposter users thanks to Spooky Plate + Judgment. No Retreat provides a great deal of stat boosts and notably makes Arceus-Ghost an effective mixed attacker, allowing it to bypass Ice Scales users much more readily than other sweepers like Take Heart Arceus formes and Ultra Necrozma. Triple Arrows OHKOes Blissey and occasionally allows Arceus-Ghost to get past checks like non-Fur Coat Yveltal and RegenVest users via flinches. Alternatively, a Poison-type move can shred Fairy-type checks like Mega Audino and Ice Scales Arceus-Fairy, with Gunk Shot being able to OHKO both after slight chip damage and Noxious Torque not missing; both can also poison would-be answers like Yveltal. Jungle Healing both provides recovery and prevents Mortal Spin's poison from stifling a sweep. While Arceus-Ghost is strong, special walls and Yveltal can almost completely nullify it with Topsy-Turvy if they don't lose to its physical move, so supporting allies like Mold Breaker Eternatus and Strength Sap blockers like Magic Guard Blissey are useful. Fur Coat Mega Audino is a particularly noteworthy problem, as multiple setup attempts are necessary to run it out of Recover PP, so Mega Lucario can help by taking advantage of its Steel weakness. Arceus-Ghost can Imposter-proof itself thanks to Spooky Plate + Judgment, but Knock Off support is recommended, as Eviolite Imposter users can use No Retreat and attempt to PP stall Judgment in a pinch; an ally like Yveltal is also useful as an emergency precaution against Spooky Plate Imposter users.

Ice Scales.description: Ice Scales Arceus-Ground fills a valuable niche as a special wall, self-Imposter-proof setup sweeper, and entry hazard remover; its Ground typing also offers a useful immunity to Thunder Cage and Volt Switch. Tidy Up supplements a strong Earthquake and allows Arceus-Ground to sweep late-game when its checks like Celesteela and Yveltal have been removed. Spirit Shackle is solely for Imposter users; after trapping one, Arceus-Ground can always boost to +6 and beat it one-on-one, putting the opponent in a heavily disadvantaged position. Strength Sap is necessary for Arceus-Ground to Imposter-proof itself, and it usually heals for more than Recover; Arceus-Ground being a physical attacker also prevents the bane of most Ice Scales Arceus formes, Magic Guard Blissey, from denying it healing. Earth Plate provides a damage boost to Earthquake and can't be removed with Knock Off or Trick, while Covert Cloak shuts down passive damage from Salt Cure and Mortal Spin, making boosting easier. Arceus-Ground's main drawback is that against teams with Strength Sap, Haze, or Topsy-Turvy Celesteela or Yveltal it's never sweeping; as a result, threats like Bolt Strike Mega Garchomp and Mega Lucario are useful teammates. Arceus-Ground can also struggle against Palkia-O and No Retreat Arceus-Ghost, so backup checks to them like Salt Cure users and Mega Audino help out. Arceus-Ground can almost always Imposter-proof itself thanks to Spirit Shackle, but if it's badly poisoned or if the Imposter user has a Covert Cloak, then some physical tank like Mega Slowbro or Yveltal can fulfil this role.

Fur Coat.description: Fur Coat Arceus-Poison is a pretty good wall thanks to its typing, which gives it an edge against foes like Kyurem-B and Pheromosa. Earth Plate + Judgment provides a solid way to hit most Steel-types and synergizes well with Mortal Spin, which can remove entry hazards against most teams; alternatively; Thunder Cage can trap and remove Imposter users while also hitting Celesteela. Strength Sap slows down most physical threats, provides an advantage against Imposter users, and offers some leeway against Ground-type coverage like Headlong Rush. Support against Ground-type attackers, like Ho-Oh and Fur Coat Yveltal, is highly recommended. Arceus-Poison also appreciates allied hazard removal, as Celesteela completely shuts Mortal Spin variants down, and Steel-types like Mega Steelix can spinblock if Arceus-Poison doesn't have many boosts. Arceus-Poison Imposter-proofs itself thanks to Earth Plate, although it usually takes a while to win the one-on-one; Jungle Healing Chansey can also deny opposing Imposter user's healing and shake off poison.

Fur Coat Arceus-Water is a strong defensive wall thanks to its great typing and bulk. Scald reliably spreads burns, helping spread chip damage and neutralize physical attackers. Knock Off removes items like Covert Cloak and Leftovers, making its burns easier to spread and more damaging, and also boosts Arceus-Water's own survivability by removing Choice Band; alternatively, Spikes can force passive damage on foes, which offensive teammates can exploit. Flip Turn allows Arceus-Water to bring in dangerous offensive teammates against Scald switch-ins like Dondozo and Giratina. Covert Cloak allows Arceus-Water to stop status from moves like Magical Torque, Nuzzle, and Scald, while Leftovers boosts its longevity. Arceus-Water's best fit is on balance teams, which appreciate a reliable physcial wall and a pivot. Offensive teammates, like Koraidon and Flutter Mane, are recommended as they enjoy the safe pivoting Arceus-Water provides and the chip damage it inflicts. Arceus-Water is best Improofed by itself, as Knock Off sets can threaten Imposter users with item removal and Scald burns.

Defensive.description: Mega Audino utilizes its very rare typing, good bulk, low Attack capable of stifling Strength Sap healing, and low Speed to be a versatile wall and an effective pivot. The ability chosen is up to team preference; Fur Coat can let it check Dragon- and Dark-type physical attackers like Mega Garchomp and Choice Band Ash-Greninja, Ice Scales can let it check various special threats like Flutter Mane and Take Heart Arceus formes, and Magic Bounce can reflect key status moves like Spikes, Glare, Strength Sap, and Toxic. Topsy-Turvy heavily deters setup from threats like Flare Boost Flutter Mane, Take Heart Arceus formes, and Mega Garchomp. Knock Off removes key items such as Assault Vest from Mega Steelix; if consistent progress making throughout the game is desired, Mortal Spin can instead be used to remove entry hazards and spread poison. Teleport is a consistent pivoting option with the switches Mega Audino often forces by denying Strength Sap healing or threatening to remove items. Moonblast hits Magic Guard Miraidon for good damage and dissuades other Magic Guard users from freely switching in. Mega Audino fits on balance or bulky teams looking for a flexible check to most of the metagame, a Pokemon with a Ghost-type immunity, or more importantly a Strength Sap blocker; thus, strong physical attackers like Ash-Greninja and Kyurem-B are good partners that appreciate its ability to limit Strength Sap healing and slow pivoting. In return, Mega Audino can Imposter-proof these attackers. Mega Audino is weak to Sunsteel Strike users like Mega Lucario, so solid checks to them like Mega Slowbro and Celesteela makes for good partners. Imposter-proof Mega Audino with Steel-type teammates, Regenerator users, or Take Heart Arceus formes carrying a Plate.

Choice Band.description: Choice Band Kyurem-B is a threatening wallbreaker. Its main advantage over the competition, being Kartana and Mega Garchomp, is its STAB-boosted Glacial Lance, which is more spammable than Gigaton Hammer and Headlong Rush and grants it a natural advantage into Fur Coat users like Yveltal. V-create threatens to OHKO Steel-types like Mega Steelix, which can otherwise scout Kyurem-B's move choice and heal off about half of the damage with Regenerator. U-turn offers dangerous teammates like Mega Mewtwo X a safe window to switch in if Kyurem-B can't secure a KO, and it can be used early-game to scout for potential Fur Coat switch-ins. Kyurem-B fits best on balance teams that can grant it opportunities through pivoting and can make room for counterplay against the few things it can't instantly get past, such as Arceus-Poison. Kyurem-B's lack of recovery and weakness to Rock mean Stone Axe is a major pain, so multiple entry hazard removers like Miraidon, Mega Steelix, and Primal Kyogre are recommended; the latter two also function as slow pivots, which Kyurem-B also appreciates. Fur Coat Arceus formes not weak to Kyurem-B's attacks, such as Arceus-Poison and Arceus-Fairy, also aren't afraid of it when healthy; as a result, it appreciates an ally that can block their Strength Sap, such as a Magic Bounce user like Mega Audino, significantly cutting into their longevity. A faster offensive teammate like Mega Mewtwo X or Deoxys-A is recommended to clean weakened teams, as Kyurem-B's poor Speed inhibits it in this regard. Imposter-proof Kyurem-B with a Fur Coat user not weak to its attacks, like Arceus-Poison or Arceus-Fairy.

Sniper.description: Using its high Speed, synergistic offensive typing, and high offensive stats, Ash-Greninja becomes a strong wallbreaker. With Flower Trick, Ash-Greninja can dent Fur Coat Slowbro without activating Rocky Helmet, OHKO Mega Swampert, and 2HKO Imposter users. Frost Breath lets Ash-Greninja OHKO Mega Garchomp and severely weaken Fur Coat Miraidon and Yveltal. Physically strong Pokemon like Mega Garchomp, Mega Lucario, and Kyurem-B appreciate Ash-Greninja's presence, as it's able to help overwhelm their checks such as Fur Coat Arceus-Ghost, Ho-Oh, and Mega Slowbro; Mega Lucario is particularly useful thanks to its strong matchup against Fur Coat Fairy-types like Mega Audino, which otherwise completely wall Ash-Greninja thanks to Rocky Helmet. Ash-Greninja can struggle against faster Pokemon such as Flutter Mane and Miraidon, as these are are all able to revenge kill it, so having teammates like Mega Steelix, Ho-Oh, and Arceus-Ground helps. Ash-Greninja also benefits immensely from having teammates that can block Strength Sap such as Mega Audino, Blissey, and Mega Slowbro, as many of its defensive checks like Miraidon and Arceus-Fairy rely on this move for healing. Having slow pivots, such as Teleport users like Mega Audino or RegenVest users like Mega Swampert, is also helpful to account for its frailty. To Imposter-proof Ash-Greninja, a Fur Coat + Rocky Helmet user like Mega Audino is ideal.

Fur Coat.description: Fur Coat Yveltal is an effective wall capable of checking threatening physical and mixed wallbreakers like Mega Garchomp, Magic Guard Mega Mewtwo X, and No Retreat Ghost-types. Knock Off is a reasonably strong STAB attack and provides useful utility, while Revelation Dance hits Arceus-Ghost harder and allows Yveltal to check Normalize users. Haze and Parting Shot are useful against No Retreat Arceus-Ghost, with Parting Shot also providing pivoting but matching up worse against Nasty Plot Arceus-Ghost. Calm Mind is an option in tandem with Revelation Dance to also check Arceus-Ghost effectively, although all Fairy-types must be removed before attempting to sweep with it. Yveltal's powerful Dark-type STAB moves deter Ghost-types, making it an effective user of Rapid Spin. If entry hazard removal is not needed, Will-O-Wisp and Nuzzle act as options for neutering threats like Mega Mewtwo X. Ability Shield is an alternative to Heavy-Duty Boots to offer a much better matchup against Teravolt Kartana and Mega Mewtwo X, but Yveltal then requires strong hazard removal and still falls prey to Sword of Ruin variants. Yveltal is susceptible to threats like Mega Diancie and Kyurem-B, so Steel- and Fire-types like Solgaleo, Zacian-C, and Victini are good teammates, and they can also provide a degree of scouting against Choice Band Mega Mewtwo X. Aforementioned offensive threats like Magic Guard Mega Mewtwo X can be Imposter-proofed by Yveltal. Knock Off variants can be Imposter-proofed by Arceus formes, while Revelation Dance sets can be Imposter-proofed by Chansey.

No Retreat.description: Lunala is a threatening setup sweeper thanks to the combination of Simple + No Retreat making it a decent complement to other setup sweepers like Simple Arceus-Ghost. Judgment + Spooky Plate lets Lunala Imposter-proof itself. Stored Power after No Retreat deals a massive chunk to special walls such as Mega Audino, Primal Kyogre, and Arceus formes. Final Gambit with Lunala's above-average HP can clear out walls like Yveltal and healthier Ice Scales users for its teammates. Lunala's damage isn't quite high enough to where it can OHKO foes through Ice Scales, so Ice Scales + Topsy-Turvy users largely shut it down; as such, support like Toxic Spikes Eternatus is useful. Lunala also struggles to break through Dark-types like Yveltal and even Ash-Greninja in a pinch, so an ally like a Thunder Cage Arceus forme can help threaten them. Lunala usually Imposter-proofs itself thanks to Spooky Plate, but in the event that a Spooky Plate Imposter user transforms into Lunala, a teammate like Fur Coat Yveltal is highly recommended to not get instantly reverse swept.

Choice Band.description: Pheromosa has one job on most teams: be the fastest thing on the field and fire off very strong U-turn. This allows it to both force out dangerous offensive threats and grab momentum at the same time. Sword of Ruin kicks up Pheromosa's power and makes it a decent supporting wallbreaker for an ally like Mega Garchomp. Glacial Lance chunks Dragon-types like Eternatus and Giratina for solid damage. Knock Off cuts into the longevity of most physical walls by removing their Leftovers and Heavy-Duty Boots, making it easier for an ally to pick them off; in addition, removing Covert Cloak opens these up to be poisoned by Mortal Spin. Pheromosa's best fit is on offense teams that are looking for a reliable way of scaring out fast threats that Imposter isn't very reliable into, like Ultra Necrozma and Ash-Greninja. Pheromosa lacks the power to beat Fur Coat users by itself, so another physical wallbreaker like Mega Garchomp is mandatory for it to be useful. Imposter-proof Pheromosa with bulky physical walls that don't mind Knock Off, like Fur Coat Earth Plate Arceus-Poison.

RegenVest.description: RegenVest Celesteela utilizes its excellent defensive typing to act as a reliable pivot capable of soft checking numerous threats, including Mega Garchomp, Flutter Mane, Tidy Up Arceus-Ground, and Take Heart Arceus formes. Knock Off provides excellent utility, nullifying offensive threats by removing items like Life Orb and Choice Specs while relieving defensive Pokemon of items like Covert Cloak and Leftovers. Stone Axe helps reduce Celesteela's passivity by providing entry hazard support for teammates. Salt Cure deters Pokemon like Take Heart Arceus formes from using Celesteela as setup bait, and it deals good chip damage to Imposter users. Doom Desire is an option to support offensive teammates against walls like Mega Audino. Beak Blast punishes moves such as U-turn and deters moves like Bolt Strike and Electro Drift. Even with Assault Vest, Celesteela's natural bulk is only decent, so it requires sturdy teammates like Ice Scales Mega Audino and Ho-Oh to pivot into to help against powerful wallbreakers like Choice Specs Flutter Mane and Mega Alakazam. Celesteela's typing also leaves it vulnerable to threats like Miraidon and Fire-type coverage from Pokemon such as Eternatus, making walls like Magic Guard Blissey desirable teammates. Imposter users also pair well with Celesteela to defeat Take Heart Arceus formes after they have been hit by Salt Cure. Imposter-proofing Celesteela can be annoying, with Take Heart Arceus formes and Magic Guard Pokemon that do not mind losing their item being decent options to do so.

Fur Coat.description: Fur Coat Celesteela acts as a decent physical wall for teams looking for a Ground immunity while soft checking Ash-Greninja and non-Mold Breaker Koraidon. Teleport brings in dangerous wallbreakers safely. Beak Blast, if it successfully burns, instantly kills any physical wallbreaker's hopes of dealing damage except mixed attackers with Electro Drift; it also outdamages Jungle Healing from Mega Garchomp. Knock Off annoys defensive switch-ins like Mega Audino by removing items like Covert Cloak, while Salt Cure can help rack up large amounts of passive damage and more directly threatens Imposter users. Stone Axe capitalizes on the switches Celesteela often forces by virtue of its typing by setting entry hazards, but it's notably worse against Imposter users. Recover provides reliable healing in the face of wallbreaker + Strength Sap blocker structures, while Strength Sap has higher burst healing against some teams, is easier to Imposter-proof, (comma) neutralizes Mega Garchomp, (comma) and helps versus Ash-Greninja. Rocky Helmet helps wear away at physical attackers without needing entry hazard support and throttles Ash-Greninja into spamming Wicked Blow, while Covert Cloak shuts off Salt Cure's crushing passive damage. Physical wallbreakers like Mega Garchomp appreciate Celesteela Imposter-proofing them and blocking Mortal Spin to keep hazards on the field to increase the odds of KOs. Celesteela can be vulnerable to Bolt Strike or Electro Drift users like Mega Lucario and mixed attackers like Ultra Necrozma, so sturdy walls to them like Miraidon and Ice Scales Arceus-Ground makes for good partners. Imposter-proof Celesteela with a Magic Bounce user, a Magic Guard user not deterred by burns or Knock Off like Arceus-Ghost, or a RegenVest user like Primal Kyogre.

Sheer Force.description: Sheer Force Ultra Necrozma boasts great Speed and offenses, making it a fast and strong mixed attacker. Thanks to Sheer Force + Life Orb, it has excellent damage output, with Luster Purge or Bolt Strike always threatening to 2HKO Arceus formes other than Arceus-Ground. Blue Flare takes down Steel-types like Registeel, Celesteela, and Mega Steelix. Magical Torque is used primarily to target Imposter users for large amounts of damage, but it also hits Giratina and Miraidon hard. Sheer Force Ultra Necrozma best fits on balance teams that can give it multiple safe opportunities to switch in, as it generally needs to get predictions correct to make any substantial progress. Pivoting support, such as with Teleport users like Mega Slowbro or RegenVest users like Mega Swampert, helps navigate Ultra Necrozma's frailty and prediction reliance. Ultra Necrozma can't really beat Ice Scales Arceus-Ground, so Toxic Spikes and Magic Bounce Flying-types like Yveltal can help by wearing it down. Ultra Necrozma also tends to get scared out by faster offensive threats like Ash-Greninja and Flutter Mane, so reliable checks to these like Mega Audino are appreciated. Imposter-proofing Ultra Necrozma with Ice Scales Arceus-Ground is the most reliable option, but options like other Ice Scales Arceus formes and Fur Coat Mega Slowbro can also work.

Adaptability.description: Adaptability Blacephalon is a powerful mixed wallbreaker. Choice Scarf makes Blacephalon the fastest relevant Pokemon in the meta, outspeeding threats like Miraidon, allowing it to double as a revenge killer and also offsetting V-create's Speed drops against slower checks like Primal Kyogre. Alternatively, Life Orb provides Blacephalon with more firepower, allowing it to hit benchmarks like OHKOing Arceus and Mega Audino after slight chip. Volt Switch retains momentum and chips Pokemon like Ice Scales Primal Kyogre and Ho-Oh into 2HKO range. Poltergeist on Life Orb sets serves as a way to hit the aforementioned Pokemon without receiving Speed drops. Trick lets Blacephalon cripple a defensive Pokemon in matchups where its Choice Scarf is unnecessary. Strength Sap provides crucial longevity to offset Life Orb recoil and entry hazard chip damage. A Naughty nature is chosen to boost V-create's damage and make Imposter users take more damage from Astral Barrage. Blacephalon benefits greatly from entry hazards that chip walls like Primal Kyogre and Fur Coat Arceus formes into 2HKO range. Conversely, due to its Stealth Rock weakness, Blacephalon also strongly appreciates teammates that provide entry hazard removal like Arceus-Ground. Slow pivots like Primal Kyogre and Mega Steelix can bring Blacephalon in safely. Blacephalon can be Imposter-proofed by Imposter Guzzlord, though other options like Fur Coat Ting-Lu and Mega Audino also work.

Ice Scales.description: Ice Scales Zacian is an effective special wall against prominent special attackers like Palkia-O and Arceus-Ghost. Spirit Break dissuades setup from Arceus formes, Eternatus, and Palkia-O, though Magical Torque is a stronger alternative. While seemingly counter-productive with Spirit Break, Haze is the best option to neuter Nasty Plot Palkia-O and Arceus-Ghost, and it also ensures Zacian beats No Retreat Arceus-Ghost. Spikes provides support for the team and makes progress against Strength Sap users. Spirit Shackle traps Imposter users, preventing them from recovering health for free on Zacian. Toxic punishes most setup special attackers like Calm Mind Arceus formes. Covert Cloak prevents burns from Palkia-O's Steam Eruption and protects against status conditions inflicted by Nuzzle and Mortal Spin. Alternatively, Heavy-Duty Boots and Leftovers help mitigate entry hazard damage and keep Zacian healthy. Ability Shield is useful against Normalize users like Dragapult and Mold Breaker users like Palkia-O. Zacian pairs very well with a secondary specially defensive pivot like RegenVest Ting-Lu or Dialga-O, as they can scout for moves from Choice Specs users while not being chipped down by Volt Switch. In return, Zacian provides a switch-in to strong Dragon-type moves while also checking setup Pokemon like Palkia-O and Nasty Plot Flutter Mane. Imposter-proofs for Spikes variants include Fur Coat Groudon and Arceus-Ground, while Toxic variants can be Imposter-proofed by Arceus-Poison and Corviknight. Tera Steel provides a resistance to Iron Bundle and Flutter Mane's Boomburst while retaining a Dragon resistance, as well as providing a Toxic immunity.

Fur Coat.description: Fur Coat Zacian differentiates itself from other Fur Coat users with its high Speed, outspeeding dangerous physical threats like Koraidon and threatening them with Knock Off or Will-O-Wisp. Spirit Break is a weaker alternative to Magical Torque that offers more PP and a useful secondary effect, preventing Calm Mind Arceus formes and Torch Song Eternatus from freely setting up. Knock Off removes important items like Choice Band and Assault Vest from Pokemon like Groudon and Ting-Lu, respectively, as well as removing Imposter Chansey's Eviolite. Will-O-Wisp neutralizes most physical attackers like Koraidon. Spirit Shackle threatens to trap and eliminate Imposter users and physical threats walled by Zacian. Toxic cripples Imposter users and most Fur Coat users. Heavy-Duty Boots and Leftovers help mitigate entry hazard damage, allowing Zacian to check physical threats more reliably, while Covert Cloak provides protection against status conditions from Nuzzle and Mortal Spin. Zacian can struggle to handle extremely powerful physical wallbreakers like Groudon and Mold Breaker Koraidon by itself, so secondary physical walls like Fur Coat Arceus formes are appreciated as teammates; they can also Imposter-proof Zacian. Despite outspeeding threats like Palkia-O and Flutter Mane, Zacian cannot switch in, so a special wall like Ice Scales Dialga-O or Chansey can help pivot Zacian in. Tera Water grants a resistance to V-create and Gigaton Hammer, the latterof which Koraidon commonly uses to threaten Zacian.

Pixilate.description: Pixilate Zacian is a powerful cleaner. Pixilate boosted Population Bomb is an incredibly strong STAB move, 2HKOing defensive behemoths like Fur Coat Dondozo at +2. Coil + Protective Pads and Swords Dance + Wide Lens both increase Population Bomb's power and accuracy, with the former bypassing Rocky Helmet and the latter providing a stronger boost, notably letting Zacian boost past Strength Sap. Rapid Spin with Pixilate provides unblockable entry hazard removal in a pinch, while Precipice Blades targets Fairy-resistant Pokemon like Arceus-Poison and Arceus-Fire. Spirit Shackle is an option with Coil to trap and eliminate Imposter users, which are otherwise problematic. Knock Off users like Ting-Lu and Groudon are mandatory for Wide Lens sets to remove Rocky Helmet. While Zacian can remove hazards with Rapid Spin, hazard setters often carry moves that can heavily cripple it like Nuzzle and Knock Off, making another hazard remover like Tidy Up Groudon or Mortal Spin Ting-Lu a good choice. Groudon notably also pressures Fairy-resistant Pokemon like Arceus-Poison and Arceus-Fire well. Imposter users serve as a strong check to this set, so having a sturdy Imposter-proofing teammate is necessary, with Rocky Helmet + Fur Coat users or Corviknight being good candidates.

Boosting Attacker.description: Eternatus serves as a strong setup attacker that can support teammates by pressuring opposing special walls and provide some defensive utility. Torch Song hits Steel-types like Celesteela while doubling as a boosting option, allowing Eternatus to pressure walls like Magic Guard Blissey. Sludge Bomb hits Fairy-types like Arceus-Fairy and Mega Audino, and it can also poison walls like RegenVest Primal Kyogre. Eternatus makes good use of Glare, as Eternatus deters Miraidon from switching in while also having a favorable matchup against common Take Heart users. Spikes allows Eternatus to make progress against walls considering its good matchup against common entry hazard removers, while Knock Off removes important items like Assault Vest to soften defensive answers to it. Strength Sap provides higher instant healing against most foes, keeping Dragon Energy strong, but Shore Up may be preferred to improve Eternatus's matchup into Blissey and is also better on Unaware sets. Mold Breaker allows Eternatus to bypass Ice Scales and Magic Bounce, and Unaware provides useful defensive utility by letting it check Take Heart Arceus formes as well as Nasty Plot and No Retreat Arceus-Ghost. Eternatus is effective at pressuring special walls, so it pairs well with special wallbreakers such as Mega Alakazam and Flutter Mane that can take advantage of this. Imposter-proof Eternatus lacking Knock Off with Imposter Chansey, and Imposter-proof Knock Off sets with specially defensive walls like Ice Scales Arceus-Fairy.

Magic Guard.description: Magic Guard Eternatus is a dangerous setup attacker with high damage output. Magic Guard helps offset Dragon Energy's high HP requirement, allowing Eternatus to use its bulk and maintain good damage output, and it also allows for a drawback-free Life Orb. While Malignant Chain is usually more consistent, Shell Side Arm can be used with maximum Attack EVs and IVs in order to more reliably dent Blissey. Nasty Plot allows for staggering damage, letting full-powered Dragon Energy 2HKO Ice Scales Arceus even if it uses Take Heart after the first hit, while Torch Song 2HKOes non-Assault Vest Celesteela, is generally easier to Imposter-proof, and doesn't leave Eternatus completely shut off by Magearna and Zacian-C. Strength Sap's high instant healing, easy Imposter-proofing, and ability to ward off slower physical attackers like Mega Lucario make it a solid choice; alternatively, Recover doesn't get shut off by Blissey and Magic Bounce users, making it much more reliable. Magic Guard Eternatus's best fit is on offense teams that want high instant damage that throttles annoying Fairy-types like Mega Audino without a Choice lock. Eternatus's biggest enemy is Blissey, as it stuffs Strength Sap, stalls Dragon Energy with Topsy-Turvy and its immense bulk, and isn't 2HKOed by Shell Side Arm; as a result, a teammate like Secret Sword Arceus-Ghost is near mandatory to get past it in a reasonable amount of time. Eternatus's Speed tier also leaves it outsped by other offensive foes like Mega Alakazam and Flutter Mane, so RegenVest users like Dialga-O help by preventing it from folding to these. Imposter-proof Torch Song Eternatus with Ice Scales users, Magic Guard Blissey, or Imposter Chansey; Nasty Plot is harder to Imposter-proof, so Magearna and specially defensive Steel-types are recommended. Paralysis support is also highly recommended on Recover sets, as a paralyzed Imposter user negates one of Recover's big drawbacks in Imposter users exploiting it for healing.

Fur Coat.description: Fur Coat Dondozo is a great defensive Pokemon with its high physical bulk and typing, which allows it to wall physical attackers such as Koraidon and Groudon. Spikes supports offensive teammates, while Haze stops foes like Tidy Up Groudon from setting up. Knock Off removes items such as Covert Cloak and Leftovers, and Scald burns provide chip damage on foes. Flip Turn makes it easier to pivot into offensive teammates such as Koraidon, since Taunt, Dark-types, and Magic Bounce don't block it; alternatively, Parting Shot makes the foe easier to handle for Dondozo's teammates, but it's stopped by Taunt and Good as Gold. Heavy-Duty Boots, notably eases Dondozo's pivoting, while Rocky Helmet punishes contact moves such as U-turn and V-create. Covert Cloak protects against secondary effects like confusion from Magical Torque and burns from Scald. Tera Fire allows Dondozo to resist Magical Torque and Grass-type moves from Arceus-Fire, and it maintains Dondozo's resistance to Fire-type moves such as V-create. Dondozo appreciates defensive teammates with typing synergy such as RegenVest Ting-Lu, which helps protect Dondozo from threatening Pokemon such as Eternatus.

Prankster.description: Prankster Dondozo with Haze can reliably check physical setup sweepers such as Groudon thanks to its huge physical bulk. Entrainment forces out Pokemon dependent on their abilities, Encore can lock foes into unfavorable moves such as setup moves or V-create, and Glare debilitates fast attackers such as Koraidon and Palkia-O. Parting Shot allows Dondozo to maintain momentum against opposing threats such as Arceus-Ghost with its priority pivoting and attack stat reduction, making it easier for teammates such as Ting-Lu to take hits from them; alternatively, Flip Turn provides a pivoting option unaffected by Taunt, Dark-types, and Magic Bounce. Heavy-Duty Boots, notably eases Dondozo's pivoting, while Covert Cloak protects it from status conditions from moves such as Nuzzle, Mortal Spin, and Magical Torque. Tera Fire improves Dondozo's matchup against Arceus-Fire with Grass-type coverage and lets it resist V-create and Magical Torque, whereas Tera Dark makes Dondozo immune to status moves from other Prankster users and improves its matchup against Ghost- and Dark-types. RegenVest Hisuian Goodra, Ting-Lu, and Fur Coat users synergize with Dondozo, covering threats such as Arceus-Fairy, Groudon, and Palkia-O.

Flare Boost.description: Flutter Mane leverages its extremely rare offensive typing, good Speed, and decent Special Attack to be a very threatening wallbreaker and cleaner. Flame Orb + Flare Boost gives it a boost that can't be copied by Imposter users alongside a pseudo-immunity to status and Knock Off's item removal. With a Nasty Plot boost, Moongeist Beam does terrifying amounts of damage to Ice Scales users, having odds of OHKOing Ice Scales Arceus formes after Stealth Rock; Flutter Mane's Speed and power also let it offensively pressure other fast offensive threats, such as Ultra Necrozma and Ash-Greninja. Flutter Mane uses Pain Split, which Imposter users can't utilize effectively, as a burst healing option thanks to its low HP stat, offsetting burn damage and allowing it to beat Magic Guard Blissey one-on-one. Flutter Mane fits on balance and offense teams looking for a powerful special wallbreaker and late-game cleaner. Moongeist Beam ignores Ice Scales but not Assault Vest, making Knock Off users like RegenVest Primal Kyogre great partners. Imposter-proofing Flutter Mane can be done by any specially defensive Normal-type with Haze or Topsy-Turvy, usually Imposter Chansey, which can also trade Knock Off with RegenVest users.

Choice Specs.description: Choice Specs Flutter Mane acts as a dangerous wallbreaker that utilizes its strong STAB combination and stats. Moongeist Beam cuts through Ice Scales, allowing Flutter Mane to bypass traditional special walls like Ice Scales Arceus formes, while Astral Barrage deals more damage to other checks like RegenVest users. Volt Switch grants Flutter Mane the option to pivot out on switch-ins like Primal Kyogre, Ice Scales Mega Audino, and Ho-Oh, while Knock Off allows it to cripple special walls by removing items like RegenVest users' Assault Vests, Ho-Oh's Heavy-Duty Boots, and Blissey's Leftovers. Beads of Ruin is an option over Adaptability to increase Volt Switch's chipping capabilities, but running it means Astral Barrage will no longer 2HKO Imposter users. Flutter Mane appreciates entry hazard support from the likes of RegenVest Mega Steelix, Primal Kyogre, and Mega Swampert, as this allows it to have an easier time threatening 2HKOs on the aforementioned Ice Scales walls like Arceus formes and Primal Kyogre. Flutter Mane necessitates a teammate that can threaten specially defensive Normal-types like Blissey, Ice Scales Mega Audino, and Ice Scales Arceus; this makes mixed attackers like Ultra Necrozma valuable. Imposter-proof Flutter Mane with a specially defensive Normal-type like Imposter Chansey.

RegenVest.description: RegenVest Ting-Lu is a reliable special wall and a premier momentum generator. Regenerator gives Ting-Lu reliable recovery without conflicting with Assault Vest. Nuzzle discourages dangerous attackers like Palkia-O from switching in. U-turn allows Ting-Lu to safely bring in teammates thanks to its low Speed. Stone Axe forces chip damage on foes, letting offensive teammates wallbreak more easily. Knock Off removes items like Heavy-Duty Boots and Covert Cloak, making Ting-Lu's own utility more effective; it also punishes Imposter users attempting to gain Regenerator. Ting-Lu fits best on balance teams, which appreciate its ability to spread paralysis and safely bring in teammates thanks to its huge bulk. Dangerous wallbreakers like Koraidon and Palkia-O help maximize the effectiveness of U-turn pivoting. Ting-Lu is unable to naturally check Palkia-O and Fairy-types like Flutter Mane, so a teammate that helps shore up this weakness, such as Arceus-Grass or Hisuian Goodra, is appreciated. Tera Fairy provides an immunity to Dragon, allowing Ting-Lu to block Dragon Energy from Palkia-O and Glaive Rush from Koraidon; alternatively, Tera Grass provides a Water resistance, covering for Palkia-O's Water Spout.

Fur Coat.description: Fur Coat Miraidon is a resilient wall with strong offensive pressure that can also check Pokemon like Mega Lucario and Ash-Greninja. Torch Song provides coverage against Mega Steelix and boosts Miraidon's Special Attack, potentially facilitating a late-game sweep. Spikes can support Miraidon's offensive teammates and force progress against hard walls like Mega Swampert. Thunder Cage + Torch Song lets Miraidon damage most Steel-types well, making it an effective user of Mortal Spin. Will-O-Wisp threatens to burn offensive threats and some switch-ins like Mega Swampert. Take Heart is another way to boost Special Attack, and also means Miraidon can’t be put on a permanent timer once it loses Covert Cloak. Miraidon struggles against Mega Garchomp and mixed attackers like Ultra Necrozma, so Pokemon like Celesteela and Arceus-Ground can pair well with it. Miraidon can be Imposter-proofed by itself in most cases due to Thunder Cage; however, Pokemon like Blissey and the aforementioned Arceus-Ground can Imposter-proof it in emergency situations.

Magic Guard.description: With Magic Guard, Miraidon is a powerful wallbreaker that can exploit passive foes relying on Mortal Spin and Salt Cure to deal damage; its typing and Speed also allow it to soft check slower foes like Mega Lucario and Ash-Greninja. Torch Song hits Steel-types like Registeel and Mega Steelix while boosting Miraidon's Special Attack. Thunder Cage traps foes, deals good chip damage to special walls, and is an overall decent high-PP STAB move; alternatively, Volt Switch makes Miraidon a very effective pivot. Dragon Energy, when boosted by Life Orb, becomes a very powerful attack against foes taking chip from Thunder Cage. Strength Sap is a burst healing option that's easy to Imposter-proof and keeps Dragon Energy's Base Power high. Miraidon's ability to heavily chip down special walls makes other special attackers like Choice Specs Flutter Mane good partners; other teammates relying on passive damage such as Salt Cure users also appreciate Miraidon as an offensive Imposter-proofer. Miraidon will never beat Arceus-Ground and struggles against Magic Guard Blissey and specially defensive Mega Swampert, so allies like Ultra Necrozma and Simple Arceus-Ghost are useful. Imposter-proof Miraidon with Ice Scales Arceus-Ground or Magic Guard Blissey; Imposter Chansey can also work, but it's less reliable due to taking chip damage from Thunder Cage.
